formattedAddress: 191 Hester St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 191 Hester St, New York, NY 10013-4704, USA

editorialSummary.text: A veteran spot for red-sauce Italian fare served in laid-back environs including an outdoor patio.

originalText.text:
Just strolling by Little Italy finding a place to eat for my wife's grandfather. We were talking to one of the servers to see about another restaurant. We were impressed that he was willing to help rather than trying to shoo us into his restaurant. Needless to say, we stayed and it was a great experience.

I wish I had more of an appetite as everything was delicious. I decided to get the Eggplant Trio thinking it was going to be small. I forgot that everything was basically family style. Everything we tasted and sampled was great. Wonderful hospitality. Next visit to NYC we will be sure to try and stop by.

text.text:

I wish I had more of an appetite as everything was delicious. I decided to get the Eggplant Trio thinking it was going to be small. I forgot that everything was basically family style. Everything we tasted and sampled was great. Wonderful hospitality. Next visit to NYC we will be sure to try and stop by.

originalText.text:
Pizza pizza pizza! I am just going to get straight to the point, this pizza was amazing. It ranks in the top 2% of all the pizza I’ve tried in my life.
We visited this place for the first time during the San Gennaro feast in New York City. Despite the fact that the crowd was massive, staff was able to manage the crowd.
We were seated promptly considering the enormous crowd. The server was kind and attentive, even with all the chaos going on outside I can’t even imagine how attentive they would be during a normal dinner service.
We ordered the pizza, stuffed mushrooms, and a fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. And as I mentioned previously, the pizza was phenomenal! The pasta dish wasn’t as great as I expected it to be, which was kind of disappointing. This is why I gave the restaurant four stars instead of five. If we had just ordered the pizza alone this restaurant deserves 10 stars.
I highly recommend their pizza…. So pay them a visit!!!

originalText.text: My partner and I stumbled into this adorable restaurant last week in little Italy Manhattan. Our server, Luis, was amazing and attentive. The food was delicious too. I can’t wait to visit again. From the aesthetic to the service everything was five stars!

text.text: My partner and I stumbled into this adorable restaurant last week in little Italy Manhattan. Our server, Luis, was amazing and attentive. The food was delicious too. I can’t wait to visit again. From the aesthetic to the service everything was five stars!

originalText.text: We went to San Gennaro, very fun, colorful and with live music. Excellent service. The food is good, not excellent. And the wine list is poor. In short, you have a good time but don't expect high Italian cuisine.

text.text: We went to San Gennaro, very fun, colorful and with live music. Excellent service. The food is good, not excellent. And the wine list is poor. In short, you have a good time but don't expect high Italian cuisine.

originalText.text:
After visiting the holiday markets we came down to Caffe Napoli, a smaller establishment
in Little Italy. Accommodations for a party of 6 were made right away. Complimentary hot rolls were delivered to the table. Service was attentive and great! We ordered the Antipasto Caldo, the Shrimp and Littleneck Clams were seasoned and filled with delicious flavors, the breading on the calamari and fried mozzarella didn’t have any flavor and tasted bland. We also ordered for the table the Antipasti Di Casa which was great. For my entree, I ordered the Chicken Parmigiana with Penne which I felt the breading could’ve been more savory. I enjoyed the appetizers more than the entree. The bathroom’s are located in the basement, down a flight of stairs. The ambiance of being in Little Italy was festive and the St.Gennaro band came in and played your choice of songs for a monetary donation. Overall experience was great. It’s best to walk here or get dropped off.
